questions.Question: What invention by Garnet Carter made its debut at the Fairyland Inn Resort in Lookout Mountain, Tennessee, in 1927?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Miniature golf by Garnet Carter made its debut at the Fairyland Inn Resort in Lookout Mountain, Tennessee, in 1927.

questions.Question: Who invented the phonograph?
questions.solution: Solution:		 John Kruesi was a mechanic for Edison, and Kruesi built the phonograph. Edison designed it, and later improved the phonograph.

questions.Question: What beverage was invented by Charles Alderton in 1885 in Waco, Texas?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Dr. Pepper was invented by Charles Alderton in 1885 in Waco, Texas.

questions.Question: In which decade was the ARRL founded?
questions.solution: Solution:		 On April 6, 1914, Hiram Percy Maxim proposed the formation of the American Radio Relay League.

questions.Question: Who invented the Seed Drill?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Jethro Tull invented the seed drill.

questions.Question: What is the name of the CalTech seismologist who invented the scale used to measure the magnitude of earthquakes?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Richter scale was developed in 1935 by American seismologist Charles Richter (1891-1989) as a way of quantifying the magnitude, or strength, of earthquakes.

questions.Question: What James Watt invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		James Watt invented rotary steam engine.

questions.Question: Where is the village of Branston, after which the famous pickle is named?
questions.solution: Solution:		The village of Branston is in Staffordshire, just south of Burton-on-Trent.

questions.Question: Who invented Jet Engine?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Dr. Hans von Ohain and Sir Frank Whittle are recognized as the co-inventors of the jet engine. Each was working separately and knew nothing of the others work. Although Whittle started first, von Ohain was first to design and develop a turbojet engine to power an aircraft.

questions.Question: What invention caused many deaths while testing it?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Many people who tried to test the first parachutes died by jumping from high places. One attempt was a parachute hat, but the inventor broke his neck while testing it. The first successful parachute was tested from a hot air balloon in 1797, in France, by Jacques Garnerin.

questions.Question: Who invented Bicycle?
questions.solution: Solution:		Kirkpatrick Macmillan invented bicycle.

questions.Question: Who synthesized the first wholly artificial gene?
questions.solution: Solution:		Synthesis of the first complete gene, a yeast tRNA, was demonstrated by Har Gobind Khorana and coworkers in 1972. Synthesis of the first peptide- and protein-coding genes was performed in the laboratories of Herbert Boyer and Alexander Markham, respectively.

questions.Question: Who discovered the first practical method of freezing food?
questions.solution: Solution:		 In the 1920s Clarence Birdseye discovered that if food was flash-frozen under pressure, it would freeze without the formation of ice crystals.

questions.Question: When was the Raggedy Ann doll patented?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Johnny Gruelle patented the Raggedy Ann doll in 1915. The Raggedy Andy doll and the Raggedy Ann books came later.

questions.Question: What Frank Whittle invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Sir Frank Whittle, (born June 1, 1907, Coventry, Warwickshire, England—died August 8, 1996, Columbia, Maryland, U.S.), English aviation engineer and pilot who invented the jet engine.

questions.Question: What Karl Benz invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Karl Benz gets the credit for inventing the automobile because his car was practical, used a gasoline-powered internal-combustion engine and worked like modern cars do today.

questions.Question: When were bar code scanners invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first scanning of the now-ubiquitous Universal Product Code (UPC) barcode was on a pack of Wrigley Company chewing gum in June 1974 at a Marsh supermarket in Troy, Ohio, using scanner produced by Photographic Sciences Corporation. QR codes, a specific type of 2D barcode, have recently become very popular.

questions.Question: When was the game Frisbee invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first Frisbee were pie tins from the Frisbee Pie Company in Connecticut. In the 1950s, the pie tins were changed to plastic plates. The name then became the Flying Saucer, but later changed to Frisbee.

questions.Question: What piece of clothing was invented by French fashion designer Louis Reard in 1946?
questions.solution: Solution:		The bikini, a two-piece swimsuit named for the Bikini Atoll in the Pacific, made its debut on July 5, 1946.

questions.Question: In which year was MIDI introduced?
questions.solution: Solution:		The MIDI specification was published in August 1983. The MIDI standard was unveiled by Kakehashi and Smith, who received Technical Grammy Awards in 2013 for their work. In 1982, the first instruments were released with MIDI, the Roland Jupiter-6 and the Prophet 600.

questions.Question: Who developed the idea of Crop Rotation?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Viscount Charles 'Turnip' Townsend developed this revolutionary concept of crop rotation.

questions.Question: Who made corn flakes at first?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Will Keith Kellogg discovered the corn flake, by mistake, in 1906. They were the result of an experiment which went wrong.

questions.Question: William Frederick is credited with the invention of the modern frisbee in the mid 1950's. In 1957 the Wham-O Company bought his idea and the rest is history. They named the toy after William Frisbie who was a ________
questions.solution: Solution:		 William Frederick is credited with the invention of the modern frisbee in the mid 1950's. In 1957 the Wham-O Company bought his idea and the rest is history. They named the toy after William Frisbie who was a pie maker.

questions.Question: Who came up with the idea for instant mashed potato?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Instant mash was invented by Edward A Asselbergs, a Canadian, in 1962. The mash is actually dehydrated potato flakes.

questions.Question: Who invented Dynamite?
questions.solution: Solution:		Alfred B. Nobel invented dynamite.

questions.Question: What drink was invented by Charles Leiper Grigg in 1929?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Charles Leiper Grigg (May 11, 1868 – April 16, 1940) was the inventor of Bib-Label Lithiated Lemon-Lime soda, better known by its later name, 7 Up. He invented the drink in October 1929.

questions.Question: For what is Charles Babbage (1792-1871) remembered?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Charles Babbage is known as the Father of Computing. He began his 'Analytical Engine' in 1833. The first computer, although he never completed it.

questions.Question: Who invented Automobiles using gasoline?
questions.solution: Solution:		On January 29, 1886, Carl Benz applied for a patent for his “vehicle powered by a gas engine.” The patent – number 37435 – may be regarded as the birth certificate of the automobile.

questions.Question: Who invented the battery?
questions.solution: Solution:		Alessandro Volta invented the battery.

questions.Question: The initials JCB on earth-moving equipment are those of the founder of the company that makes it. What is his name?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Joseph Cyril Bamford founded the company that makes these iconic machines in 1945, in a 12ft X 15ft garage in Staffordshire.

questions.Question: For what does the world owe Almon Strowger a debt of gratitude?
questions.solution: Solution:		He was an undertaker, and legend has it, he developed the automatic switch in 1889, to stop competitors from getting his work.

questions.Question: In which decade was the telegraph invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		The system was completed and public use initiated on May 24, 1844, with transmission of the message, “What hath God wrought!” This inaugurated the telegraph era in the United States, which was to last more than 100 years. Key-type Morse telegraph transmitter from the 1840s. Morse telegraph register from the 1840s.

questions.Question: What inspired reflecting road lights to be invented?
questions.optionB: The light a cat's eyes gave off on a fence
questions.optionC: Sun light on steel posts on road sides
questions.optionD: The sun light on the windshield
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1933, Englishman Percy Shaw was driving home when he saw a cat's eyes reflecting. He had been headed straight towards a fence with the cat on it, but on the other side was a drop of hundreds of feet.

questions.Question: When were blue jeans invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		On May 20, 1873, San Francisco businessman Levi Strauss and Reno, Nevada, tailor Jacob Davis are given a patent to create work pants reinforced with metal rivets, marking the birth of one of the world's most famous garments: blue jeans.

questions.Question: Who invented Electric Generator?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first electromagnetic generator, the Faraday disk, was invented in 1831 by British scientist Michael Faraday. Generators provide nearly all of the power for electric power grids.

questions.Question: What treat was invented by 11-year-old Frank Epperson in 1905?
questions.solution: Solution:		 The next time you pop a Popsicle in your mouth, think about this: You're enjoying the fruits of an 11-year-old entrepreneur's labor. Back in 1905, a San Francisco Bay Area kid by the name of Frank Epperson accidentally invented the summertime treat.

questions.Question: When was Milk Tray first introduced?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Milk Tray was introduced in 1915 in open boxes arranged on wooden trays. Today, with its distinctive purple and gold cartons and popularised by the "Man in Black" television adverts, its one of the most popular chocolate assortments.

questions.Question: When was the toothbrush invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		The creator of the first mass-produced toothbrush is believed to have been William Addis of England in 1780. Addis had been jailed in 1770 for inciting a riot. In jail, he developed a toothbrush consisting of an animal bone and bristles made of pigs' hair that were inserted into drilled holes and held in place by glue. After his release, he started a toothbrush manufacturing company called ADDIS that stayed in his family until 1996 and still manufactures toothbrushes today.

questions.Question: What item of apparel was invented by Ellery Chun, a Hawaiian clothing merchant, in 1931?
questions.solution: Solution:		 An Aloha shirt is a brightly coloured tropical print shirt that is a popular souvenir of Hawaii.

questions.Question: Who invented Fountain Pen?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lewis E. Waterman invented Fountain Pen.

questions.Question: When was the first Lionel trains manufactured?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Joshua Lionel Cowen and Harry C. Grant started the Lionel Manufacturing Company on Sept. 5, 1900 in New York City. The first train, which was called the Electric Express, was manufactured in 1901 and was an open gondola propelled by a fan motor. As time has passed, the trains have been made in different colors and styles.

questions.Question: What item, originally called the 'Whirlwind', was invented by Ives McGaffey in 1869?
questions.solution: Solution:		Vacuum cleaner originally called the 'Whirlwind', was invented by Ives McGaffey in 1869.

questions.Question: Who invented Bakelite?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Leo Hendrik Baekeland invented the first plastic called Bakelite.

questions.Question: What toy was invented by Joshua Lionel Cowen around 1900?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Joshua Lionel Cowen (August 25, 1877 – September 8, 1965) was an American inventor and the co-founder of Lionel Corporation, a manufacturer of model railroads and toy trains. Cowen also invented the flash-lamp in 1899, an early photographer's flash light source.

questions.Question: This African-American woman physical therapist worked with soldiers disabled in World War II. She invented a device that helped the disabled to eat by delivering food through a tube to a mouthpiece.
questions.solution: Solution:		 Unfortunately Blount could never get anyone to buy her invention. Finally, in 1952 she sold the rights to the French government.

questions.Question: What plaything was invented by Joe McVicker in 1956?
questions.solution: Solution:		Play-Doh was invented by Joe McVicker in 1956.

questions.Question: Who was the first American female to patent her invention, a method of weaving straw with silk?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Mary was not the first American woman inventor to be sure, there were many female inventors before her, but they never bothered to get a patent.

questions.Question: Who invented Gramophone?
questions.solution: Solution:		Gramophone was invented by Thomas Edison, Emile Berliner and Eldridge R. Johnson. Gramophone is also known as phonograph.

questions.Question: What furniture item was invented by California furniture designer Charles Prior Hall in 1968?
questions.solution: Solution:		Waterbed was invented by California furniture designer Charles Prior Hall in 1968.

questions.Question: The Manhattan Project was started by President Roosevelt in 1942 to ensure that the U.S. beat the Germans in developing a nuclear bomb. Whom did Roosevelt appoint as scientific head the Manhattan Project?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Leslie R. Groves, however, was the military head of the project and the overall supremo, while Robert Oppenheimer was the scientific director. The world's first atomic bomb was exploded in the New Mexico desert on July 16, 1945.

questions.Question: When was the first elevator built?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first elevator was built in the palace of King Louis XV in 1743. It only traveled up one floor, and was hand powered by men inside the chimney.

questions.Question: What charge card, developed in 1950, was the first to be accepted nationally in the US?
questions.solution: Solution:		The card was invented by Frank McNamara and Ralph Schneider.

questions.Question: What Enrico Fermi invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Enrico Fermi ( 29 September 1901 – 28 November 1954) was an Italian (later naturalized American) physicist and the creator of the world's first nuclear reactor, the Chicago Pile-1.

questions.Question: Which of the following was first patented by an Australian in 1889?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Electric Drill was the invention of Arthur James Arnot. On 20 August 1889 he patented his design while working for the Union Electric Company in Melbourne. His original design was meant primarily for drilling rock to find coal.

questions.Question: Who among the following invented the small pox vaccine?
questions.solution: Solution:		The smallpox vaccine, introduced by Edward Jenner in 1796, was the first successful vaccine to be developed. He observed that milkmaids who previously had caught cowpox did not catch smallpox and showed that inoculated vaccinia protected against inoculated variola virus.

questions.Question: Who invented Gunpowder?
questions.solution: Solution:		Roger Bacon invented gunpowder.

questions.Question: Until Victorian times, chocolate was thought of as a drink. When did the first chocolate bar appear?
questions.solution: Solution:		No one knows for sure when the first chocolate bar appeared or even who made it, but an important event occurred in 1828. The Van Houten press was invented, which extracted cocoa butter from the bean - the same press that brought the Cadbury Brothers success with Cocoa Essence.

questions.Question: What now ubiquitous device was invented by Zenith engineer Eugene Polley in 1955?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first wireless remote control for television was called Flashmatic.

questions.Question: What Benjamin Franklin invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Benjamin Franklin invented bifocal spectacles in 1760.

questions.Question: This part-time race car driver invented the bucket seat in 1969. Who was he??
questions.solution: Solution:		McQueen invented the bucket seat in 1969.

questions.Question: What invention is credited to the Russian born American inventor Vladimir Kosma Zworykin?
questions.solution: Solution:		Vladimir Zworykin, in full Vladimir Kosma Zworykin, (born July 29 [July 17, Old Style], 1888, Murom, Russia—died July 29, 1982, Princeton, New Jersey, U.S.), Russian-born American electronic engineer and inventor of the iconoscope and kinescope television systems.

questions.Question: Benjamin Franklin was a prolific inventor. He invented the lightning rod, the Franklin stove, studied electricity, discovered the Gulf Stream, started the first library, and on and on. Among his many other inventions, what musical instrument did he invent?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ben also holds a lot of firsts - first U.S. ambassador, first political cartoonist, first American philosopher, organized the first fire department, and on and on.

questions.Question: What Thomas Davenport invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Thomas Davenport (9 July 1802 – 6 July 1851) was a Vermont blacksmith who constructed the first American DC electric motor in 1834.

questions.Question: What Elisha Otis invented?
questions.optionA: The brake used in modern elevators
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1853, American inventor Elisha Otis demonstrated a freight elevator equipped with a safety device to prevent falling in case a supporting cable should break. This increased public confidence in such devices. Otis established a company for manufacturing elevators and patented (1861) a steam elevator.

questions.Question: Where was the yo-yo invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		The yo-yo was first used by hunters as weapons. They were wooden disks on strings. In the 1920s, a man from the U.S. named Donald Duncan made the yo-yo into a toy after he visited the Philippines.

questions.Question: When was the first lawn mower invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first lawn mowers were not engine powered. Invented in 1830 by Edwin Budding of England, the mowers were turning blades on wooden sticks used to cut grass. Engine powered mowers were not invented until 1919 by an American Army colonel, who used the motor from a washing machine.

questions.Question: In which decade were the first successful diode and triode vacuum tubes invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		In 1904, John Ambrose Fleming invented the first practical electron tube called the 'Fleming Valve', which is a diode rectifier. In 1906, Lee de Forest invented the Audion later called the triode, which provided signal amplification.

questions.Question: Who is the English physicist responsible for the 'Big Bang Theory'?
questions.solution: Solution:		George Gamow, who died in 1968, was a physicist, who published "Thirty Years that Shook Physics".

questions.Question: What 'game' was first produced by the Southern Novelty Company in Baltimore, Maryland in 1892?
questions.solution: Solution:		The board was invented by Isaac and William Fuld. The word 'Ouija' comes from the French and German words for 'yes', 'oui' and 'ja'.

questions.Question: Which insurance salesman invented the fountain pen in 1884?
questions.solution: Solution:		Lewis Edson Waterman patented the first practical fountain pen in 1884.

questions.Question: In which decade was the spice simulator introduced?
questions.solution: Solution:		SPICE (Simulation Program with Integrated Circuit Emphasis) was introduced in May 1972 by the University of Berkeley, California.

questions.Question: Who invented the first controllable flying AEROPLANE (AIRPLANE)?
questions.solution: Solution:		Wilbur and Orville Wright made the first successful controlled powered flight at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina, in December 1903. The twelve second flight covered a distance of 120 feet and an altitude of just ten feet.

questions.Question: What groovy item was invented by Englishman Edward Craven Walker in 1963?
questions.solution: Solution:		Groovy, baby! Lava lamps, which were a fixture in every hip pad in the 1960s and 70s, featured a mixture of water and colored oil that created swirl patterns when heated by a light bulb.

questions.Question: In which decade was the Internet first implemented?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first message ever sent over what is now called the Internet took place at 10:30 PM on October 29, 1969. Back then, the Department of Defense called it ARPA net (Advanced Research Projects Agency network).

questions.Question: For over 500 years, paper was only available and sold as single sheets. In 1902, an inventive Australian used half size sheets of paper, a bit of glue and cardboard to create the what?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Birchall's of Launceston in Tasmania started selling the world’s first notepads, calling them 'Silvercity Writing Tablets' after J A Birchall thought it would be a good idea to back sheets of paper with cardboard and glue them together at the top. His British paper suppliers weren’t so keen, but, they were persuaded by Birchall that it was a good idea!

questions.Question: Who invented the ballpoint pen?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Hungarian brothers, Laszlo and George Biro, made the first ball point pen in 1894. It followed the first workable fountain pen which was invented by L.E. Waterman in 1884.

questions.Question: In which decade was the first solid state integrated circuit demonstrated?
questions.solution: Solution:		On September 12, 1958, Jack Kilby demonstrated the first working IC while working for Texas Instruments, although the U.S. patent office awarded the first patent for an integrated circuit to Robert Noyce of Fairchild.

questions.Question: What J. B. Dunlop invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Scotsman John Dunlop developed the first practical pneumatic tire in 1888.

questions.Question: Which scientist discovered the radioactive element radium?
questions.solution: Solution:		Marie Curie discovered the radioactive element radium.

questions.Question: When was barb wire patented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Joseph F. Glidden was born in New York on Jan. 18, 1812. He invented barbed wire in 1873 and was granted the patent on Nov. 24, 1874. After a three year battle over the patent, which he eventually won, Gidden became known as the "Father of Barbed Wire".

questions.Question: What African-American inventor received 5 patents in the field of shoemaking?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Jan Ernst Matzeliger received 5 patents in the field of shoemaking.

questions.Question: It travels over land and water. Who invented the hovercraft?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Christopher Cockerell invented the hovercraft in 1956. His early experiments with the idea involved a cat food tin, a coffee tin and an industrial blower.

questions.Question: In which decade was the AEEE (now the IEEE) founded?
questions.solution: Solution:		 The IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers) was formed in 1963 by the merger of the Institute of Radio Engineers (IRE, founded 1912) and the American Institute of Electrical Engineers (AIEE, founded 1884).

questions.Question: What type of system did  Paul Nipkow, John Baird, and Charles Jenkins all invent?
questions.solution: Solution:		 All of the inventors mentioned invented an early mechanical television system.

questions.Question: What Sir Isaac Newton invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sir Isaac Newton invented Chronometer.

questions.Question: What device for new parents did Ann Moore invent in 1969?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ann got the idea for the Snugli infant carrier from the traditional African baby carriers she observed while a volunteer for the Peace Corps in Africa.

questions.Question: In which decade was the transistor invented?
questions.solution: Solution:		On December 23, 1947, William Shockley, Walter Brattain and John Bardeen, of Bell Labs, announced their discovery of the point-contact germanium transistor to management.

questions.Question: What invention was first installed at a Hartford, Connecticut bank in 1889?
questions.solution: Solution:		William Gray, inventor of the pay telephone, also invented the inflatable chest protector worn by baseball umpires and catchers.

questions.Question: Ralph Samuelson was only 18 when he invented this sporting item in 1922. What was that?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ralph Samuelson was only 18 when he invented water skis.

questions.Question: Who invented Bifocal Lens?
questions.solution: Solution:		Benjamin Franklin invented bifocal lens.
